comment: He is a great professor truly, everything a professor should be. He doesn't throw too much at you, his quizzes and tests cover the topics but do not make it too complicated, he helps a lot and makes learning harder things like proof by induction easy. If you have the chance to take him for discrete math, he is without a doubt the one to take.

he is such a great prof, i wish he taught other math classes because id sign up for him asap. made discrete math so simple and easy. he gives extra credit. 1 homework due each week, not a lot of work at all just make sure you review the concepts outside of class please! i remember being on the waitlist for this class, so glad i ended up getting in.

Great professor! He records and uploads his lectures and notes. Attendance wasn't mandatory. This class is lecture heavy. His homework is based on examples from the lectures and on paper. He's accessible outside class and responds to emails quickly. The reviews for his 3 midterms help, but the actual tests have more content than the review.

Just a super great teacher, very quiet but super smart and knowledgeable he has 3 tests, midterms 1 and 2, and a final, he allows one sheet of notes front and back for the tests and there is one homework a week. To what I thought would be a boring and painful class he made it interesting and worthwhile.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Great professor! He has been nothing but a wonderful person. I really appreciate you and everything you have done for us as a class. I would love this professor to be every math professor I have. Great guy!

My teacher of all time. Professor Wilson is probably the gold standard for Discrete at KSU, you will not regret taking him.

Your grade will likely consist of weekly homework assignments, two midterms, and a final. Midterms are roughly 5-7 questions long, you get to skip one question and do it at home for extra credit.

He is the BEST professor I have ever had! I will forever remember his class! His teaching style is phenomenal and he makes learning math so fun and interesting. You will also learn so much! His tests clearly reflect what he teaches in class and he gives lots of extra credit. He responds to emails fast, and he is always willing to help! PLEASE TAKE!

Professor Wilson is one of the best professor I have ever encountered in my life, you can learn A LOT from his class in a gentle but definitely rewarding way. I am impressed by his way of teaching and any words would seem be plain for his perfectness. Highest recommendation for him.
Great teacher, a little quiet. Very receptive to student concerns. Loved Discrete math with him.

Awesome professor! Always willing to help out when you need it. Definitely cares about his students and wants them to succeed. This class isn't super easy, but Prof Wilson gives a homework assignment each week worth 50% of your grade. The rest of the class is 2 midterms and a final. He also gives a few extra credit opportunities as well.

Prof. Wilson is as perfect as you can get with a math professor. He teaches very well, is fair with grading, and offers his students several opportunities to succeed. You will get homework about every week and will take two exams and a final. He allows you to use a cheatsheet on the exams which are very helpful. Overall, take him if you can!

Andy was such a good professor. He took his time after each homework to go over each problem and make sure that everyone understands the material and how it works. He care about you passing and is not to hard on the grading scale. I would definitely take him over anyone else for discrete maths.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best Discrete teacher at KSU! The grading is set up to where the homework is worth 50% of the grade, 2 tests that are 15% each, and a final that is worth 20%. It definitely gives a strong opportunity to pass if you don't do so hot on the tests, but the tests are very understandable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Seriously the best math teacher I've ever had. I was told discrete math would be hard, but he walks you through each topic very thoroughly, and if you still don't get it, you can see him after class. Since it's during COVID, I am doing the course online and having no trouble.

Does random participation checks but they don't count for too much. Records lectures and explains topics well. Answers emails and will answer questions effectively. The tests I took were open note, and had fair questions. Overall great prof, doesn't make me want to die and I'm actually learning.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor, clearly explains everything, no textbook use, half of your grade is homework, take some test you have a week to complete.

Best professor I've ever had, he cares about students and their success and understanding of the course. There is homework almost weekly, 2 midterms with one in-class multiple choice section (open note) and one take home section, one take home final, and he takes attendance every once in a while for extra credit.
Professor Wilson is kind, flexible, and wants his students to succeed in the course. A large percentage of our grade was from homework or take-home assignments. Easy A and I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures
